standard_metadata.standard_description: Use informal arguments to establish facts about the angle sum and exterior angle of triangles, about the angles created when parallel lines are cut by a transversal, and the angle-angle criterion for similarity of triangles.

question.content: In the following diagram,  $\overline{BC}$ is parallel to $\overline{DE}$.  **What is the measure of $\blueD{\angle x}$?**   *Angles are not necessarily drawn to scale.*         $\blueD{\angle x}$ $=$ $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line BC and line DE.  Line FC intersects the parallel lines at point A and C.  Line segment AB connects the parallel lines.  Points B and D are on the same side of line FC. Angle ABC is 54 degrees.  Angle BAC is 105 degrees. Angle DAF is x degrees.

hints.content: The interior angles of a triangle always add up to $180^\circ$.  $\begin{align}\greenD{\angle ABC} + \purpleD{\angle BAC} +\maroonD{\angle BCA} &= 180^\circ \\\\ \greenD{54^\circ}+\purpleD{105^\circ} + \maroonD{\angle BCA}&= 180^\circ  \\\\ \maroonD{\angle BCA} &= 21^\circ \end{align}$    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line BC and line DE.  Line FC intersects the parallel lines at point A and C.  Line segment AB connects the parallel lines.  Points B and D are on the same side of line FC. Angle ABC is 54 degrees.  Angle BAC is 105 degrees. Angle BCA is 21 degrees. Angle DAF is x degrees.

hints.content: Since $\overline{BC}$ is parallel to $\overline{DE}$, $\maroonD{\angle BCA}$ and $ \blueD{\angle{DAF}}$ are corresponding angles, so they are congruent.  $\blueD{\angle DAF}$ is the same as $\blueD{\angle x}.$  So  $\maroonD{\angle BCA}$ and $ \blueD{\angle{x}}$ $ = \blueD{21^\circ}$.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line BC and line DE.  Line FC intersects the parallel lines at point A and C.  Line segment AB connects the parallel lines.  Points B and D are on the same side of line FC. Angle ABC is 54 degrees.  Angle BAC is 105 degrees. Angle BCA is 21 degrees. Angle DAF is 21 degrees.

question.content: In the following diagram,  $\overline{BC}$ is parallel to $\overline{DE}$.  **What is the measure of $\blueD{\angle x}$?**   *Angles are not necessarily drawn to scale.*       $\blueD{\angle x}$ $=$ $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line BC and line DE.  Line FC intersects the parallel lines at point A and C.  Line segment AB connects the parallel lines.  Points B and D are on the same side of line FC. Angle ABC is 42 degrees.  Angle BAC is 103 degrees. Angle DAF is x degrees.

hints.content: The interior angles of a triangle always add up to $180^\circ$.  $\begin{align}\greenD{\angle ABC} + \purpleD{\angle BAC} +\maroonD{\angle BCA} &= 180^\circ \\\\ \greenD{42^\circ}+\purpleD{103^\circ} + \maroonD{\angle BCA}&= 180^\circ  \\\\ \maroonD{\angle BCA} &= 35^\circ \end{align}$   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line BC and line DE.  Line FC intersects the parallel lines at point A and C.  Line segment AB connects the parallel lines.  Points B and D are on the same side of line FC. Angle ABC is 42 degrees.  Angle BAC is 103 degrees. Angle BCA is 35 degrees. Angle DAF is x degrees.

hints.content: Since $\overline{BC}$ is parallel to $\overline{DE}$, $\maroonD{\angle BCA}$ and $ \blueD{\angle{DAF}}$ are corresponding angles, so they are congruent.  $\blueD{\angle DAF}$ is the same as $\blueD{\angle x}.$  So  $\maroonD{\angle BCA}$ and $ \blueD{\angle{x}}$ $ = \blueD{35^\circ}$.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line BC and line DE.  Line FC intersects the parallel lines at point A and C.  Line segment AB connects the parallel lines.  Points B and D are on the same side of line FC. Angle ABC is 42 degrees.  Angle BAC is 103 degrees. Angle BCA is 35 degrees. Angle DAF is 35 degrees.

question.content: In the following diagram,  $\overline{BC}$ is parallel to $\overline{DE}$.  **What is the measure of $\blueD{\angle x}$?**   *Angles are not necessarily drawn to scale.*       $\blueD{\angle x}$ $=$ $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line BC and line DE.  Line FC intersects the parallel lines at point A and C.  Line segment AB connects the parallel lines.  Points B and D are on the same side of line FC. Angle ABC is 42 degrees.  Angle BAC is 109 degrees. Angle EAC is x degrees.

hints.content: The interior angles of a triangle always add up to $180^\circ$.  $\begin{align}\greenD{\angle ABC} + \purpleD{\angle BAC} +\maroonD{\angle BCA} &= 180^\circ \\\\ \greenD{42^\circ}+\purpleD{109^\circ} + \maroonD{\angle BCA}&= 180^\circ  \\\\ \maroonD{\angle BCA} &= 29^\circ \end{align}$    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line BC and line DE.  Line FC intersects the parallel lines at point A and C.  Line segment AB connects the parallel lines.  Points B and D are on the same side of line FC. Angle ABC is 42 degrees.  Angle BAC is 109 degrees. Angle BCA is 29 degrees. Angle EAC is x degrees.

hints.content: Since $\overline{BC}$ is parallel to $\overline{DE}$, $\maroonD{\angle BCA}$ and $ \blueD{\angle{CAE}}$ are alternate interior angles, so they are congruent.  $\blueD{\angle CAE}$ is the same as $\blueD{\angle x}.$  So  $\maroonD{\angle BCA}$ and $ \blueD{\angle{x}}$ $ = \blueD{29^\circ}$.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line BC and line DE.  Line FC intersects the parallel lines at point A and C.  Line segment AB connects the parallel lines.  Points B and D are on the same side of line FC. Angle ABC is 42 degrees.  Angle BAC is 109 degrees. Angle BCA is 29 degrees. Angle EAC is 29 degrees.

Points B and D are on the same side of line FC. Angle ABC is 41 degrees.  Angle BAC is 102 degrees. Angle BCA is 37 degrees. Angle EAC is x degrees.

hints.content: Since $\overline{BC} $ is parallel to $\overline{DE}$, $\maroonD{\angle BCA}$ and $ \blueD{\angle{CAE}}$ are alternate interior angles, so they are congruent.  $\blueD{\angle CAE}$ is the same as $\blueD{\angle x}.$  So  $\maroonD{\angle BCA}$ and $ \blueD{\angle{x}}$ $ = \blueD{37^\circ}$.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line BC and line DE.  Line FC intersects the parallel lines at point A and C.  Line segment AB connects the parallel lines.  Points B and D are on the same side of line FC. Angle ABC is 41 degrees.  Angle BAC is 102 degrees. Angle BCA is 37 degrees. Angle EAC is 37 degrees.

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line BC and line DE.  Line FC intersects the parallel lines at point A and C.  Line segment AB connects the parallel lines. question.content: **What is the measure of $\blueD{\angle x}$?**   *Angles are not necessarily drawn to scale.*        $\blueD{\angle x}$ $=$  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: A figure made up of 5 line segments that form a star shape. Line segment AC, line segment CD, line segment CB, line segment BE, and line segment EA. Angle B is 36 degrees. Angle D is 39 degrees. Angle EHI is x degrees.

hints.content: The interior angles of a triangle always add up to $180^\circ$.  $\begin{align}\greenD{\angle BDH} + \maroonD{\angle DBH}  + \purpleD{\angle DHB}   &= 180^\circ \\\\ \greenD{39^\circ}+\maroonD{36^\circ} + \purpleD{\angle DHB}&= 180^\circ  \\\\ \purpleD{\angle DHB} &= 105^\circ \end{align}$   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A figure made up of 5 line segments that form a star shape. Line segment AC, line segment CD, line segment CB, line segment BE, and line segment EA. Angle B is 36 degrees. Angle D is 39 degrees. Angle GHI is 105 degrees. Angle EHI is x degrees.

hints.content: $\purpleD{\angle DHB}$ and $\blueD{\angle x}$ are supplementary angles because they form a straight line.  $\begin{align}\purpleD{\angle DHB} + \blueD{\angle x} &= 180^\circ \\\\ \purpleD{105^\circ}+\blueD{\angle x} &= 180^\circ  \\\\ \blueD{\angle x} &= 75^\circ \end{align}$   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A figure made up of 5 line segments that form a star shape. Line segment AC, line segment CD, line segment CB, line segment BE, and line segment EA. Angle GHI is 105 degrees. Angle EHI is 75 degrees.

question.content: **What is the measure of $\blueD{\angle x}$?**   *Angles are not necessarily drawn to scale.*       $\blueD{\angle x}$ $=$  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: A figure made up of 5 line segments that form a star shape. Line segment AC, line segment CD, line segment CB, line segment BE, and line segment EA. Angle B is 40 degrees. Angle D is 31 degrees. Angle EHI is x degrees.

hints.content: The interior angles of a triangle always add up to $180^\circ$.  $\begin{align}\greenD{\angle BDH} + \maroonD{\angle DBH}  + \purpleD{\angle DHB}   &= 180^\circ \\\\ \greenD{31^\circ}+\maroonD{40^\circ} + \purpleD{\angle DHB}&= 180^\circ  \\\\ \purpleD{\angle DHB} &= 109^\circ \end{align}$   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A figure made up of 5 line segments that form a star shape. Line segment AC, line segment CD, line segment CB, line segment BE, and line segment EA. Angle B is 40 degrees. Angle D is 31 degrees. Angle GHI is 109 degrees. Angle EHI is x degrees.

hints.content: $\purpleD{\angle DHB}$ and $\blueD{\angle x}$ are supplementary angles because they form a straight line.  $\begin{align}\purpleD{\angle DHB} + \blueD{\angle x} &= 180^\circ \\\\ \purpleD{109^\circ}+\blueD{\angle x} &= 180^\circ  \\\\ \blueD{\angle x} &= 71^\circ \end{align}$   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A figure made up of 5 line segments that form a star shape. Line segment AC, line segment CD, line segment CB, line segment BE, and line segment EA. Angle GHI is 109 degrees. Angle EHI is 71 degrees.

images.alt: A figure made up of 5 line segments that form a star shape. Line segment AC, line segment CD, line segment CB, line segment BE, and line segment EA. Angle B is 47 degrees. Angle D is 31 degrees. Angle GHI is 102 degrees. Angle GHC is x degrees.

images.alt: A figure made up of 5 line segments that form a star shape. Line segment AC, line segment CD, line segment CB, line segment BE, and line segment EA. Angle B is 47 degrees. Angle D is 31 degrees. Angle GHI is 102 degrees. Angle GHC is 78 degrees.

images.alt: A figure made up of 5 line segments that form a star shape. Line segment AC, line segment CD, line segment CB, line segment BE, and line segment EA. Angle B is 46 degrees. Angle D is 33 degrees. Angle GHC is x degrees.

hints.content: The interior angles of a triangle always add up to $180^\circ$.  $\begin{align}\greenD{\angle BDH} + \maroonD{\angle DBH}  + \purpleD{\angle DHB}   &= 180^\circ \\\\ \greenD{33^\circ}+\maroonD{46^\circ} + \purpleD{\angle DHB}&= 180^\circ  \\\\ \purpleD{\angle DHB} &= 101^\circ \end{align}$    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A figure made up of 5 line segments that form a star shape. Line segment AC, line segment CD, line segment CB, line segment BE, and line segment EA. Angle B is 46 degrees. Angle D is 33 degrees. Angle GHI is 101 degrees. Angle GHC is x degrees.

hints.content: $\purpleD{\angle DHB}$ and $\blueD{\angle x}$ are supplementary angles because they form a straight line.  $\begin{align}\purpleD{\angle DHB} + \blueD{\angle x} &= 180^\circ \\\\ \purpleD{101^\circ}+\blueD{\angle x} &= 180^\circ  \\\\ \blueD{\angle x} &= 79^\circ \end{align}$   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A figure made up of 5 line segments that form a star shape. Line segment AC, line segment CD, line segment CB, line segment BE, and line segment EA. Angle B is 46 degrees. Angle D is 33 degrees. Angle GHI is 101 degrees. Angle GHC is 179 degrees.

question.content: **What is the measure of $\blueD{\angle x}$?**   *Angles are not necessarily drawn to scale.*       $\blueD{\angle x}$ $=$  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: A figure made up of 5 line segments that form a star shape. Line segment AC, line segment CD, line segment CB, line segment BE, and line segment EA. Angle JIH is 105 degrees. Angle D is 39 degrees. Angle AJF is x degrees.

hints.content: $\purpleD{\angle DIJ}$ and $\maroonD{\angle AIC}$ are supplementary angles because they form a straight line.  $\begin{align}\purpleD{\angle DIJ} + \maroonD{\angle JIC} &= 180^\circ \\\\ \purpleD{\angle DIJ}+\maroonD{ 105^\circ} &= 180^\circ  \\\\ \purpleD{\angle DIJ} &= 75^\circ \end{align}$    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A figure made up of 5 line segments that form a star shape. Line segment AC, line segment CD, line segment CB, line segment BE, and line segment EA. Angle JIH is 105 degrees. Angle D is 39 degrees. Angle JID is 75 degrees. Angle AJF is x degrees.

hints.content: The interior angles of a triangle always add up to $180^\circ$.  $\begin{align}\greenD{\angle JDI} +  \purpleD{\angle DIJ} + \goldD{\angle DJI}   &= 180^\circ \\\\ \greenD{39^\circ}+ \purpleD{75^\circ} + \goldD{\angle DJI} &= 180^\circ  \\\\ \goldD{\angle DJI}  &= 66^\circ \end{align}$   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A figure made up of 5 line segments that form a star shape. Line segment AC, line segment CD, line segment CB, line segment BE, and line segment EA. Angle JIH is 105 degrees. Angle D is 39 degrees. Angle JID is 75 degrees. Angle DJI is 66 degrees. Angle AJF is x degrees.

hints.content: $\goldD{\angle DJI}$ and $ \blueD{\angle{x}}$ are vertical angles, so they are congruent.  $\goldD{\angle DJI}$ and $\blueD{\angle{x}}$ $ = \blueD{66^\circ}$   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A figure made up of 5 line segments that form a star shape. Line segment AC, line segment CD, line segment CB, line segment BE, and line segment EA. Angle DJI is 66 degrees. Angle AJF is 66 degrees.

question.content: **What is the measure of $\blueD{\angle x}$?**   *Angles are not necessarily drawn to scale.*       $\blueD{\angle x}$ $=$  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: A figure made up of 5 line segments that form a star shape. Line segment AC, line segment CD, line segment CB, line segment BE, and line segment EA. Angle JIH is 107 degrees. Angle D is 31 degrees. Angle AJF is x degrees.

hints.content: $\purpleD{\angle DIJ}$ and $\maroonD{\angle AIC}$ are supplementary angles because they form a straight line.  $\begin{align}\purpleD{\angle DIJ} + \maroonD{\angle JIC} &= 180^\circ \\\\ \purpleD{\angle DIJ}+\maroonD{ 107^\circ} &= 180^\circ  \\\\ \purpleD{\angle DIJ} &= 73^\circ \end{align}$   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A figure made up of 5 line segments that form a star shape. Line segment AC, line segment CD, line segment CB, line segment BE, and line segment EA. Angle JIH is 107 degrees. Angle D is 31 degrees. Angle JID is 73 degrees. Angle AJF is x degrees.

hints.content: The interior angles of a triangle always add up to $180^\circ$.  $\begin{align}\greenD{\angle JDI} +  \purpleD{\angle DIJ} + \goldD{\angle DJI}   &= 180^\circ \\\\ \greenD{31^\circ}+ \purpleD{73^\circ} + \goldD{\angle DJI} &= 180^\circ  \\\\ \goldD{\angle DJI}  &= 76^\circ \end{align}$   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A figure made up of 5 line segments that form a star shape. Line segment AC, line segment CD, line segment CB, line segment BE, and line segment EA.  Angle D is 31 degrees. Angle JID is 73 degrees. Angle DJI is 76 degrees. Angle AJF is x degrees.

hints.content: $\goldD{\angle DJI}$ and $ \blueD{\angle{x}}$ are vertical angles, so they are congruent.  $\goldD{\angle DJI}$ and $\blueD{\angle{x}}$ $ = \blueD{76^\circ}$   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A figure made up of 5 line segments that form a star shape. Line segment AC, line segment CD, line segment CB, line segment BE, and line segment EA. Angle DJI is 76 degrees. Angle AJF is 76 degrees.

question.content: In the following diagram   $\overline{DE} \parallel \overline{FG}$  and $\overline{KL} \perp \overline{FG}$.  **What is the measure of $\blueD{\angle x}$?**   *Angles are not necessarily drawn to scale.* Given the following:           $\blueD{\angle{x}} = $  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line DE and line FG.  Line KL intersects the parallel lines at points A and B.  Line IJ intersects the parallel lines at points A and C.  Angle IAK is 58 degrees.  Angle GCJ is x degrees.

hints.content: $\purpleD{\angle{BAC}}$ and $ \green{\angle{IAK}}$ are vertical angles.  So  $\purpleD{\angle{BAC}} =  \green{\angle{IAK}}$.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line DE and line FG.  Line KL intersects the parallel lines at points A and B.  Line IJ intersects the parallel lines at points A and C.  Angle IAK is 58 degrees.  Angle BAC is 58 degrees. Angle GCJ is x degrees.

hints.content: $\overline{KL} \perp \overline{FG}$, so $\goldD{\angle{ABC}} = \goldD{90^\circ}$.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line DE and line FG.  Line KL intersects the parallel lines at points A and B.  Line IJ intersects the parallel lines at points A and C.  Angle BAC is 58 degrees. Angle ABC is 90 degrees. Angle GCJ is x degrees.

hints.content: The interior angles of a triangle always add up to $180^\circ$.   $\begin{align}\purpleD{\angle BAC} + \goldD{\angle ABC} +\maroonD{\angle{BCA}} &= 180^\circ \\\\ \purpleD{58^\circ}+\goldD{90^\circ} + \maroonD{\angle{BCA}}&= 180^\circ  \\\\ \maroonD{\angle{BCA}} &= 32^\circ \end{align}$       [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line DE and line FG.  Line KL intersects the parallel lines at points A and B.  Line IJ intersects the parallel lines at points A and C.  Angle BAC is 58 degrees. Angle ABC is 90 degrees. Angle ACB is 32 degrees. Angle GCJ is x degrees.

hints.content: $\maroonD{\angle{BCA}}$ and $ \blueD{\angle{x}}$ are vertical angles, so they are congruent.  $\maroonD{\angle{BCA}}$ and $\blueD{\angle{x}}$ $ = \blueD{32^\circ}$    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line DE and line FG.  Line KL intersects the parallel lines at points A and B.  Line IJ intersects the parallel lines at points A and C. Angle ACB is 32 degrees. Angle GCJ is 32 degrees.

hints.content: The interior angles of a triangle always add up to $180^\circ$.   $\begin{align}\purpleD{\angle BAC} + \goldD{\angle ABC} +\maroonD{\angle{BCA}} &= 180^\circ \\\\ \purpleD{62^\circ}+\goldD{90^\circ} + \maroonD{\angle{BCA}}&= 180^\circ  \\\\ \maroonD{\angle{BCA}} &= 28^\circ \end{align}$    [[☃ image 1]]

Angle IAK is 62 degrees. Angle BAC is 62 degrees. Angle ABC is 90 degrees. Angle ACB is 28 degrees. Angle GCJ is x degrees.

hints.content: $\purpleD{\angle{BCA}}$ and $ \blueD{\angle{GCJ}}$ are vertical angles.  So  $\purpleD{\angle{BCA}} =  \blueD{\angle{GCJ}}$    [[☃ image 1]]

hints.content: $\overline{KL} \perp \overline{FG}$, so $\goldD{\angle{ABC}} = \goldD{90^\circ}$.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line DE and line FG.  Line KL intersects the parallel lines at points A and B.  Line IJ intersects the parallel lines at points A and C.  Angle IAK is x degrees. Angle ACB is 70 degrees. Angle ABC is 90 degrees.

hints.content: The interior angles of a triangle always add up to $180^\circ$.   $\begin{align}\purpleD{\angle BCA} + \goldD{\angle ABC} +\maroonD{\angle{BAC}} &= 180^\circ \\\\ \purpleD{70^\circ}+\goldD{90^\circ} + \maroonD{\angle{BAC}}&= 180^\circ  \\\\ \maroonD{\angle{BAC}} &= 20^\circ \end{align}$   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line DE and line FG.  Line KL intersects the parallel lines at points A and B.  Line IJ intersects the parallel lines at points A and C.  Angle IAK is x degrees. Angle ACB is 70 degrees. Angle ABC is 90 degrees. Angle BAC is 20 degrees.

hints.content: $\maroonD{\angle{BAC}}$ and $ \greenD{\angle{x}}$ are vertical angles, so they are congruent.  $\maroonD{\angle{BAC}}$ and $\greenD{\angle{x}}$ $ = \greenD{20^\circ}$    [[☃ image 1]]

question.content: In the following diagram   $\overline{DE} \parallel \overline{FG}$  and $\overline{KL} \perp \overline{FG}$.  **What is the measure of $\greenD{\angle x}$?**   *Angles are not necessarily drawn to scale.*Given the following:            $\greenD{\angle{x}} = $  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line DE and line FG.  Line KL intersects the parallel lines at points A and B.  Line IJ intersects the parallel lines at points A and C.  Angle IAK is x degrees.  Angle GCJ is 63 degrees.

hints.content: $\purpleD{\angle{BCA}}$ and $ \blueD{\angle{GCJ}}$ are vertical angles.  So  $\purpleD{\angle{BCA}} =  \blueD{\angle{GCJ}}$    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line DE and line FG.  Line KL intersects the parallel lines at points A and B.  Line IJ intersects the parallel lines at points A and C.  Angle IAK is x degrees.  Angle GCJ is 63 degrees. Angle ACB is 63 degrees.

hints.content: $\overline{KL} \perp \overline{FG}$, so $\goldD{\angle{ABC}} = \goldD{90^\circ}$.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line DE and line FG.  Line KL intersects the parallel lines at points A and B.  Line IJ intersects the parallel lines at points A and C.  Angle IAK is x degrees.  Angle ACB is 63 degrees. Angle ABC is 90 degrees.

hints.content: The interior angles of a triangle always add up to $180^\circ$.   $\begin{align}\purpleD{\angle BCA} + \goldD{\angle ABC} +\maroonD{\angle{BAC}} &= 180^\circ \\\\ \purpleD{63^\circ}+\goldD{90^\circ} + \maroonD{\angle{BAC}}&= 180^\circ  \\\\ \maroonD{\angle{BAC}} &= 27^\circ \end{align}$   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line DE and line FG.  Line KL intersects the parallel lines at points A and B.  Line IJ intersects the parallel lines at points A and C.  Angle IAK is x degrees.  Angle ACB is 63 degrees. Angle ABC is 90 degrees. Angle BAC is 27 degrees.

hints.content: $\maroonD{\angle{BAC}}$ and $ \greenD{\angle{x}}$ are vertical angles, so they are congruent.  $\maroonD{\angle{BAC}}$ and $\greenD{\angle{x}}$ $ = \greenD{27^\circ}$   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line DE and line FG. Line KL intersects the parallel lines at points A and B. Line IJ intersects the parallel lines at points A and C. Angle IAK is 27 degrees. Angle BAC is 27 degrees.

question.content: In the following diagram, $\overline{HI}$ is parallel to $\overline{JK}$.  **What is the measure of $\blueD{\angle x}$?**   *Angles are not necessarily drawn to scale.*         $\blueD{\angle{x}} = $   $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line JK and line HI.  Line AJ intersects the parallel lines at points H and J.  Line AK intersects the parallel lines at points I and K.  Angle HAI is 66 degrees.  Angle AHI is 56 degrees. Angle AKJ is x degrees.

hints.content: Since $\overline{HI}$ is parallel to $\overline{JK}$, $\goldD{\angle{AJK}}$ and $ \green{\angle{AHI}}$ are corresponding angles.  So  $\goldD{\angle{AJK}} = \green{\angle{AHI}}$.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line JK and line HI.  Line AJ intersects the parallel lines at points H and J.  Line AK intersects the parallel lines at points I and K.  Angle HAI is 66 degrees.  Angle AHI is 56 degrees. Angle AKJ is x degrees. Angle AJK is 56 degrees.

hints.content: The interior angles of a triangle always add up to $180^\circ$.  $\begin{align}\purpleD{\angle JAK} + \goldD{\angle AJK} +\blueD{\angle x} &= 180^\circ \\\\ \purpleD{66^\circ}+\goldD{56^\circ} + \blueD{\angle x}&= 180^\circ  \\\\ \blueD{\angle x} &= 58^\circ \end{align}$    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two parallel lines labeled line JK and line HI.  Line AJ intersects the parallel lines at points H and J.  Line AK intersects the parallel lines at points I and K.  Angle HAI is 66 degrees.  Angle AKJ is 58 degrees. Angle AJK is 56 degrees.

question.content: **What is the measure of $\blueD{\angle x}$?**   *Angles are not necessarily drawn to scale.*         $\blueD{\angle x} = $  $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Triangle ABC with 1 exterior angle. Line segment AD is on the outside of the triangle and angle DAB makes the exterior angle. Angle DAB is 114 degrees. Angle ABC is 56 degrees. Angle BCA is x degrees.

hints.content: $\greenD{\angle DAB}$ and $\goldD{\angle BAC}$ are supplementary angles because they form a straight line.  $\begin{align}\greenD{\angle DAB} + \goldD{\angle BAC} &= 180^\circ \\\\ \greenD{114^\circ}+\goldD{\angle BAC} &= 180^\circ  \\\\ \goldD{\angle BAC} &= 66^\circ \end{align}$       [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Triangle ABC with 1 exterior angle. Line segment AD is on the outside of the triangle and angle DAB makes the exterior angle. Angle DAB is 114 degrees. Angle ABC is 56 degrees. Angle BCA is x degrees. Angle BAC is 66 degrees.

hints.content: The interior angles of a triangle always add up to $180^\circ$.  $\begin{align}\purpleD{\angle ABC} + \goldD{\angle BAC} +\blueD{\angle x} &= 180^\circ \\\\ \purpleD{56^\circ}+\goldD{66^\circ} + \blueD{\angle x}&= 180^\circ  \\\\ \blueD{\angle x} &= 58^\circ \end{align}$      [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Triangle ABC with 1 exterior angle. Line segment AD is on the outside of the triangle and angle DAB makes the exterior angle. Angle DAB is 114 degrees. Angle ABC is 56 degrees. Angle BCA is 58 degrees. Angle BAC is 66 degrees.

images.alt: Triangle ABC with 1 exterior angle. Line segment AD is on the outside of the triangle and angle DAB makes the exterior angle. Angle DAB is 123 degrees. Angle ABC is 58 degrees. Angle BCA is x degrees. Angle BAC is 57 degrees.

question.content: **What is the measure of $\greenD{\angle x}$?**   *Angles are not necessarily drawn to scale.*          $\greenD{\angle x} = $   $\Large{{}^\circ}$

images.alt: Triangle ABC with 1 exterior angle. Line segment AD is on the outside of the triangle and angle DAB makes the exterior angle. Angle DAB is x degrees. Angle ABC is 69 degrees. Angle BCA is 66 degrees.

hints.content: The interior angles of a triangle always add up to $180^\circ$.  $\begin{align}\purpleD{\angle ABC} + \goldD{\angle BAC} +\blueD{\angle ACB} &= 180^\circ \\\\ \purpleD{69^\circ}+\goldD{\angle BAC} + \blueD{66^\circ}&= 180^\circ  \\\\ \goldD{\angle BAC} &= 45^\circ \end{align}$     [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Triangle ABC with 1 exterior angle. Line segment AD is on the outside of the triangle and angle DAB makes the exterior angle. Angle DAB is x degrees. Angle ABC is 69 degrees. Angle BCA is 66 degrees. Angle BAC is 45 degrees.

hints.content: $\greenD{\angle DAB}$ and $\goldD{\angle BAC}$ are supplementary angles because they form a straight line.  $\greenD{\angle DAB}$ is the same as $\greenD{\angle x}.$  $\begin{align}\greenD{\angle x} + \goldD{\angle BAC} &= 180^\circ \\\\ \greenD{\angle x}+\goldD{45^\circ} &= 180^\circ  \\\\ \greenD{\angle x}&= 135^\circ \end{align}$    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Triangle ABC with 1 exterior angle. Line segment AD is on the outside of the triangle and angle DAB makes the exterior angle. Angle DAB is 135 degrees. Angle ABC is 69 degrees. Angle BCA is 66 degrees. Angle BAC is 45 degrees.

hints.content: The interior angles of a triangle always add up to $180^\circ$.  $\begin{align}\purpleD{\angle ABC} + \goldD{\angle BAC} +\blueD{\angle ACB} &= 180^\circ \\\\ \purpleD{68^\circ}+\goldD{\angle BAC} + \blueD{70^\circ}&= 180^\circ  \\\\ \goldD{\angle BAC} &= 42^\circ \end{align}$.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Triangle ABC with 1 exterior angle. Line segment AD is on the outside of the triangle and angle DAB makes the exterior angle. Angle DAB is x degrees. Angle ABC is 68 degrees. Angle BCA is 70 degrees. Angle BAC is 42 degrees.

hints.content: $\greenD{\angle DAB}$ and $\goldD{\angle BAC}$ are supplementary angles because they form a straight line.  $\greenD{\angle DAB}$ is the same as $\greenD{\angle x}.$  $\begin{align}\greenD{\angle x} + \goldD{\angle BAC} &= 180^\circ \\\\ \greenD{\angle x}+\goldD{42^\circ} &= 180^\circ  \\\\ \greenD{\angle x}&= 138^\circ \end{align}$     [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Triangle ABC with 1 exterior angle. Line segment AD is on the outside of the triangle and angle DAB makes the exterior angle. Angle DAB is 138 degrees. Angle ABC is 68 degrees. Angle BCA is 70 degrees. Angle BAC is 42 degrees.
